description.narrative: ..The Multilateral Fund for the Implementation of the Montreal Protocol (MLF) is assisting the Government of Burundi in complying with its phase-out target of ozone-depleting substances. The sector involved is the commercial air conditioning and refrigeration-serving sector. The Executive Committee (ExCom) of the Multilateral Fund for the Implementation of the Montreal Protocol, at its 65th meeting, approved stage I of the HCFC phase-out management plan (HPMP) for Burundi for the period 2011 to 2020 to meet the 35% reduction in HCFC consumption. At its 85th Meeting in July 2020, the ExCom further approved the funding for the preparation of the HPMP Stage II for the Government of Burundi. UN Environment (lead implementing agency) and UNIDO (co-operating implementing agency) are implementing the project. The HPMP Phase-out commitment is 100% for the stage II for the period 2021 to 2030. The baseline of the HCFC consumption was established at 7.15 ODP tonnes by the government. The Government of Burundi reported a consumption of 2.04 ODP tonnes of HCFC in 2018, which is 71.5% below the country#s baseline. The country does not produce any HCFC.
